channel.title: Projects on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Projects
item.description:
Table of content

  • Overview
  • Create a New Project
  • List of existing Projects
  • The Project Roles
  • List of existing Project Roles
  • Project Custom Fields
  • The Default Project
  • How to questions
  • Related articles

Overview

If you want to group cases into different categoris you will use project. You can have cases from different workflow in the same project.

  • In Home Page you can see which cases belong to certain project. In searching for project you can add next criterias:
    • To see just projects which cases are in choosen status.
    • To see just projects from same Workflow.
    • You can choose which cases you want to see (All Cases, Unassigned Cases, All Cases that you’ve created, etc.).
    • You have checkbox and if you checked it you can include closed cases in searching for a project.
  • If you have a case which doesn’t belong to any project, you will use Corresponding project (which you select when creating a new company), so it will be placed in corresponding project of case creator’s company. If corresponding project is not populated, tenant’s default project will be used.

To access Projects Page go to Setup >> Projects.

Create a New Project

  1. Click New Project
  2. Fill out the form fields – Name, Unique Key, Description, Project Roles, Project Leader, System Roles and Permission Groups
    • Project Roles - you can choose a specific user (by autocomplete) to whom project role is going to be assigned. By default, when a case is created it is assigned to a default role called ‘Project Leader’.
    • With System Roles and Permission Groups you can set which users will have access to this project.
  3. Click Add
  4. Your project will appear in the table of listed project.

List of existing Projects

You can see list of already created projects in the Projects tab. Information about projects which you can see is Name of the project, Shortcut, Project Roles, Permission Groups, and you can execute some actions under the certain project.

  • To edit project click on Actions button near desired project, and then on Edit.
  • If you want to see when and by whom the project is created click on Actions button near desired project, and then on Details.
  • To see users which have access to project, click on Actions button near desired project, and then on Viewable By. A popup will be displayed with list of users.
  • If you want to translate name of the project, click on Actions button near desired project, and then on Translate. Choose dictionary and write translation.
  • If you want to export data for backup purposes or to import to another tenant, click on Actions button and then on Download Data. It will download an .wfb file with your object exported in Jason format. You can import it via Migration Manager to another tenant.
  • To delete project, click on Actions button an then on Delete. The Delete action can’t be executed when:
    • The desired project is already in use (have case(s))
  • To search for a project try typing in Search box, or click on search options. Click here to learn more.

The Project Roles

Here you can see list of already created roles, or create a new one. To create a new Project Role:

  1. Click New Project Role
  2. Fill out the form fields – Name, System ID, Description, and you have checkbox Required where you can choose whether you want from your role to be selected in all projects or not
  3. Click Add
  4. Your project role will appear in the table of listed project roles.

List of existing Project Roles

You can see list of already created project roles in the Project Roles tab. Information about project roles which you can see is Name of the project role and Description, and you can execute some actions under the certain project role.

  • To edit project role click on Actions button near desired project role, and then on Edit.
  • If you want to translate name of the project, click on Actions button near desired project, and then on Translate. Choose dictionary and write translation.
  • If you want to export data for backup purposes or to import to another tenant, click on Actions button and then on Download Data. It will download an .wfb file with your object exported in Jason format. You can import it via Migration Manager to another tenant.
  • To delete project role, click on Actions button an then on Delete. The Delete action can’t be executed when:
    • ??
  • To search for a project role try typing in Search box, or click on search options. Click here to learn more.

Project Custom Fields

In the Project Custom Fields tab you can set permissions about custom fields. You can:

  • Select which users will be able to see project custom fields. Clicking on this link opens a popup where you can select system roles and permission groups which will have ability to edit project custom fields.
  • Select which users will be able to edit project custom fields. Clicking on this link opens a popup where you can select system roles and permission groups which will have ability to edit project custom fields.
  • Manage project custom fields. This opens Form Designer where you can add all custom fields you need.

The Default Project

In the Default Project tab you can choose one of your created projects to become the default project. When you create a new case, if you don’t choose project in which that case will be, it will be placed in the default project.
